One who has a program-wide approach and establishes positive rapport with staff and student-athletes. Responsible for running daily practices, supervising assistant coaches, and planning and organizing two home track meets. Community and District Information: The West Linn-Wilsonville School District is nestled within two thriving cities, West Linn and Wilsonville, within the rural area of Clackamas County. Both communities have a strong legacy of support for their schools, music and arts endeavors, and the overall well-being of their patrons. The school district and surrounding communities have experienced steady, constant growth over the past three decades. The estimated student population of the District as of December 2024 is 8,900. It is the policy of the West Linn-Wilsonville Board of Education and School District (WLWV) that no discrimination or harassment on the grounds of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veterans' status, genetic information, or disability shall occur if the employee with or without reasonable accommodation, is able to perform the essential functions of the position. These protections apply to students, employees, and other members of the public. West Linn-Wilsonville School District is committed to equal access and equal opportunity in all activities/services, educational programs, and employment. Persons having questions regarding equal opportunity and nondiscrimination should contact the Director of Human Resources at the West Linn-Wilsonville School District, 503-673-7095.

Job.JobTitle: Head Boys Tennis Coach - Benson HS - 25/26 SY - District Athletics
Job.JobDescription:
Posting Timeline This job is open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as received. Portland Public Schools reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any point during the posting period.
Position Details DISTRICT MISSION: At PPS, our goal is that by the end of elementary, middle and high school every student by name is meeting or exceeding academic standards and is fully prepared to make productive life decisions. DISTRICT PROFILE: To obtain more information about our district, schools, learning environment and programs, please go to https://www.pps.net/Domain/265. Key points of the job description for a Varsity Head Coach: High ethical and professional standards. Direct a successful grade 9-12 program and oversee all facets of an entire community youth program. 3 years of High School coaching experience Be a role model for high school student-athletes. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports by encouraging student-athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program. Lead student-athletes in the support of other Portland Public Schools athletics and activities. The Head Coach will be responsible for the following: Manage all aspects of the high school program including training, practice schedules and routines. Hire and oversee a staff of assistant coaches Provide regular communication with parents/families Regularly track the academic progress of all student athletes in the program and facilitate necessary supports to ensure their academic eligibility. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports and encourage athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program for athletics.
All new hired coaches will need to complete the following prior to employment: NFHS/ASEP Certification First Aid Card (CPR and AED trained) District Fingerprinting/Criminal check Completion of OSAA Concussion Test Completion of ODE Steroid Test Completion of OSAA Heat Test *Head Up Football *Cheer and Dance/Drill Spirit Safety Training Completion of Portland Public School District paperwork and trainings.

Job.JobTitle: .5 FTE Assistant Track Coach - Caldera High School - Regular
Job.JobDescription:
Bend-La Pine Schools is committed to the principle of equity. Equity supersedes the notion of equality, where all are treated the same. Pursuing equity requires the removal of barriers and the promotion of inclusive practices so that all students fully benefit. The principle of equity will inform all BLS policies, regulations, programs, operations, practices, and resource allocations.
Our goal is to find the best candidate for the position, and we acknowledge that that candidate may be an individual from a less traditional background. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of our qualifications described. If you are unsure whether you meet the qualifications of a position, or how this would be determined, please feel free to contact Human Resources to discuss your application.
As you prepare to submit your application for employment, please note that all consideration of experience for the position and initial salary placements will be based upon the information you submit with your original application. Resumes must be detailed and verifiable for successful experience credit, any information provided to Bend-La Pine Schools at a later date will not be the basis for adjustments in salary placement.
Bend La Pine Schools Assistant Coaching Details
General Job Qualifications and Key Responsibilities of the Assistant Coach:
Hold high ethical and professional standards. Be an appropriate role model for high school student-athletes. Hold high expectations and accountability both behaviorally and academically for all student-athletes and coaching staff. Ability to develop, articulate, and implement a vision for your individual discipline. Ability to work in a cooperative and harmonious manner in an educationally based, school-wide athletic program. Experience in the specific discipline at high school level preferred. Be relationship/process oriented. Be involved in fundraising for the program. Communicate effectively with head coach and athletic director. Be an advocate for the multi-sport athlete. Be a supporter of the head coach and the direction they are taking the program. Other duties as assigned by Head Coach & Athletic Director.
Newly hired coaches will be required to complete or show proof of the following certifications prior to employment: 1. NFHS Fundamentals of Coaching (one-time requirement, previous completion will be recognized) 2. Concussion in Sports (yearly) 3. Heat Illness Prevention (every 4 years) District Background check 4. Appearance and Performance Enhancing Drugs and Substances Training (every 4 years) 5. Heads up certification (Yearly) (Football only)
Job.Location: Caldera High School, 60925 SE 15th Street, Bend, OR, 97702, United States

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS at FUGETT MIDDLE SCHOOL is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At FUGETT MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - MS - ASST. Coach - Girls Soccer FMS at FUGETT MIDDLE SCHOOL allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.
Job.Location: FUGETT MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season
Job.JobDescription:
The Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season position at Red Land High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Red Land High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Anticipated Football Assistant Coach - Fall 2026 Season role at Red Land High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.CompanyDescription: West Shore School District coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription: Title: Assistant Coach - Flag Football Location: High School Available: ASAP Reports to: Athletic Director Terms of Employment: Stipend in accordance with EDR contract as stated in the PEA Collective Bargaining Agreement Description: Pennridge School District is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable individual to serve as an Assistant Coach for our Flag Football program. This role supports the Head Coach in providing leadership, mentorship, and instruction to student-athletes while promoting a positive, inclusive team culture. Key Responsibilities: * Assist the Head Coach with planning and leading practices and competitions. * Support the development of student-athletes' skills, teamwork, and sportsmanship. * Promote academic achievement and personal growth among athletes. * Assist with supervision and safety of all team members during activities. * Help manage equipment and maintain team standards of conduct. * Model positive behavior and represent the school in a professional manner. * Follow all school, district, league, and state athletic association rules. Minimum Qualifications: * High school diploma or equivalent. * Some coaching or playing experience in the sport (preferably at the high school level). * Basic understanding of the game, rules, and strategy. * Strong communication and interpersonal skills. * Ability to work collaboratively with the Head Coach and school staff. Preferred Qualifications: * CPR/First Aid certification. * NFHS coaching certification or willingness to obtain. * Experience working with youth or student-athletes. * Familiarity with school athletic program policies and procedures. Pre-Employment Paperwork Requirements: Physical and Clearances must be dated within the last 12-months. TB test within the last 90-days. * PA State Police Clearance (Act 34) * Child Abuse Clearance (Act 151) * FBI Fingerprint Clearance (Act 114) * School Personnel Health Form (Physical and TB test) * PDE 6004 Form (Act 24) * Sexual Misconduct/Abuse Disclosure Release Form(s) (Act 168) Procedure: Interested candidates applying for the above position should submit an online application.

The Girls Track Coach position at Indian Valley Middle School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Girls Track Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Girls Track Coach at Indian Valley Middle School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Indian Valley Middle School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Girls Track Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Girls Track Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Girls Track Coach position at Indian Valley Middle School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.
Job.Location: Indian Valley Middle School - Harleysville, Pennsylvania

Job.JobDescription: Position: Track & Field Coaches Location: Colonial Middle School - Spring Season Colonial Middle School Athletics is seeking qualified, motivated individuals to join our Track & Field coaching staff for the upcoming season. Positions include assistant-level roles and opportunities for leadership within. Responsibilities include: Supporting student-athletes in achieving academic and athletic growth Collaborating with the athletic director and other coaches to plan and implement effective training sessions Promoting sportsmanship, teamwork, and positive school representation Assisting with meet preparation, supervision, and logistics Qualifications: Previous experience in coaching or competitive track & field preferred. Applications must be submitted on-line, we do not accept e-mails or paper applications. Deadline: Until Filled Position Type: Part-Time
Job.Experience: Previous experience in coaching or competitive track & field preferred

Job.JobDescription:
The 9th Grade Boys Football Coach at Plymouth Whitemarsh High School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the 9th Grade Boys Football Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Plymouth Whitemarsh High School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The 9th Grade Boys Football Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the 9th Grade Boys Football Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the 9th Grade Boys Football Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Plymouth Whitemarsh High School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.
Job.Experience: Playing and/or coaching experience is preferred

Job.JobTitle: Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls)
Job.JobDescription:
The Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) role at William Tennent High School emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At William Tennent High School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent William Tennent High School at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Outdoor Track - Assistant Coaches (Boys and Girls) must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at William Tennent High School.

Job.JobTitle: Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach at Carlisle Area is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Carlisle Area, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Assistant Middle School Girls Volleyball Coach at Carlisle Area allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Job.JobTitle: Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach at Cedar Crest Middle School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Cedar Crest Middle School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Cedar Crest Middle School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Cedar Crest Middle School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Boys' Wrestling - Head Middle School Coach role at Cedar Crest Middle School.
Job.Location: Cedar Crest Middle School, 101 East Evergreen Road, Lebanon, PA 17042

Job.JobTitle: Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach role at North Hills School District is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At North Hills School District, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At North Hills School District, the Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Flag Football - Girls Varsity Head Coach at North Hills School District is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Job.JobTitle: Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach at North Hills School District is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at North Hills School District use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The Copy Of Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at North Hills School District. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 1.14.25 Cheltenham School District announces the following extra duty-extra pay position is available for the 2026-2027 school-year, at Cheltenham High School:
EDEP: 2026-27 Soccer [Boys] - JV Head Coach
Qualifications * Must have extensive knowledge of the sport and the ability to effectively teach and communicate fundamental skills. * Must have at least 2 - 4 years of coaching experience working with children and/or adolescents; coaching at the high school level preferred. * A strong understanding of the sport's theory and practice is required; experience as a player or coach at the high school or collegiate level is preferred. * Must demonstrate the personal qualities necessary to foster sportsmanship and support student-athlete success in a positive and encouraging environment. * The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication, organizational, and collaboration skills, along with a proven ability to build relationships with student-athletes, parents, staff, and school administration. * Applicants must be prepared to submit required background checks that are no more than one year old from the date of issue, in accordance with state law.

Job.JobDescription: Head Coach Girls Junior Varsity Softball Position Summary/Goal: The Head Coach will facilitate and entrance communication and collaboration between and among the Erie School District and parents, students, and community members. The Head Coach will promote a positive school culture and foster academic excellence and exemplify good character for the individual athlete. Furthermore, the Erie School District expects the Head Coach to be a positive role model, a mentor to student-athletes, and embrace all concepts of good citizenship. Term of Employment: 12 month position Schools/Location: Erie High School Reporting Relationships: High School Varsity Head Coach Reports to Athletic Director & Building Administrator May work on specific projects with program directors or building principals. Qualifications: Head coaching experience at the high school or middle school level, minimum of 3 years’ experience required. Evidence of leading a successful middle school or high school softball program with a winning record and post season coaching experience. Ability to transition student athletes to the next competitive level (ability to articulate concrete examples and procedures regarding the transition of student athletes to the next competitive level). The ability to design offensive and defensive strategies. Evidence of practice plans developed in prior coaching positions. Must possess strong interpersonal skills and communication skills. Urban student experience a plus. Possess a thorough understanding of all PIAA and NFHS rules appropriate to the sport. Must hold or obtain FBI, Criminal Check, and Child Abuse Clearances. Working knowledge of Erie School District policies, procedures, and organizational structure. Knowledge of current trends, tactics, strategies, and skills of the sport. Special Requirements: Must complete all Coaching Education requirements of the PIAA and PDE. Work Environment: School and office with frequent travel between schools, and various locations within the Erie community. Occasional travel to relevant professional conferences and meetings outside the district. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Must monitor grades and conduct of student athletes. Implement the program philosophy created by Varsity Girls Softball Coaches. Attend all season practices, games, and tournaments. Develop and organize gym schedule with Athletic department for practices and games. Create and share practice schedule and phone list for players and parents. Create weekly practice plans and forward to High School Girls Varsity coach by Monday morning each week during season. Run 2 hour practices 4- 5 days a week (games are exception) & dedicate 1st hour of each practice to skills and player development. Maintain and review transportation schedule for away games. Instruct players in the rules, regulations, equipment, and techniques of the sport. Organize and direct individual and small group practice activities/exercises as directed by the Head Varsity Girls Softball Coach. Assess skills of athletes, monitor athletes during competition and practice, and keep the Head Varsity Girls Softball Coach informed of the athletic performance of students. Participate in special activities to include parent nights, banquets, award nights, and pep assemblies. Perform support tasks such as distributing and maintaining eligibility forms, emergency data cards, and other related records. Assist in evaluating and choosing middle school team with coaches in the program. Organize events that crossover with Varsity program (i.e. team night at home varsity game). Organize and run junior varsity fundraisers for season tournaments, off-season leagues and team gear, etc. Host parent meeting before the first game. Maintain positive communication with athletes, families, community members, and district administration. Attend off-season area team camps and possible fall leagues. Organize off-season open gym/weight room sessions, practice plans, and instruction. Other Duties: Attend staff meetings, clinics and other professional activities to improve coaching performance. Perform any other related duties as assigned by the Head Softball Coach, Athletic Director & Principal or other appropriate administrator. Evaluation: High School Girls Varsity Head Coach, Building Administrator, and Athletic Director This list is intended to be illustrative rather than complete and serves to show major duties and responsibilities and does not express or imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the incumbent in this position. The employee will be required to perform any other position-related duties requested by the supervisor.

Job.JobDescription:
Summary: We are seeking dedicated and enthusiastic individuals to serve as Volunteer Coaches within our district-wide sports programs. This role is ideal for those who are passionate about youth development and sports, and who want to make a positive impact in the lives of young athletes. Volunteer Coaches will work closely with student-athletes to promote teamwork, sportsmanship, and skill development while fostering a supportive and inclusive environment.
Requirements:
Act 34: PSP Criminal Record Check Act 151: PA Child Abuse History Certification Act 168: Commonwealth of PA Sexual Misconduct/Abuse Disclosure Information Request Act 114: FBI Background Check (if PA residency is less than 10 years) PIAA Requirements
Job.Location: District Wide, 425 N. Washinton Ave Scranton, PA 18503

Job.JobDescription: Bensalem High School is accepting applications for Assistant Coaches for all Winter sports activities in the 2025-2026 Fall Season. The Assistant coach assits the head coach in all aspects of the program. The successful candidate will have knowledge of the sport and be willing to work with secondary students. Flexible schedule is required as the Assistant coach will be expected to coordinate and attend practices and games. Requirements: Previous coaching experience Strong communication skills Ability to lead, motivate, and teach student athletes Ability to develop and train student athletes Flexible schedule is required Ability to play the sport and know the rules of the sport.

The Varsity Assistant Boys Volleyball Coach at Manheim Township School District is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the Varsity Assistant Boys Volleyball Coach are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at Manheim Township School District use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The Varsity Assistant Boys Volleyball Coach recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the Varsity Assistant Boys Volleyball Coach collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The Varsity Assistant Boys Volleyball Coach maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at Manheim Township School District. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.
Job.Location: Manheim Township High School, 115 Blue Streak Blvd, Lancaster, PA 17601
Job.Experience: Experience working with students is preferred

Job.JobDescription: Our Human Resources Team at the Greenville County School District is dedicated to advancing student achievement by recruiting and employing the highest qualified staff for our schools and to serve those with whom we work. Summary: Athletic positions require someone with proven decision-making skills, a track record of initiative and effort and a commitment to young people and education. Our jobs require a “people person” that indicates through actions a personality that is conducive to positive interactions with students, staff and parents. To view the job description for each type of athletic coach, click here on the Athletics Position Descriptions. Click here on the Supplements for Athletics link to see athletics supplementary salary schedule. Coaching positions require the following Continuing Education Requirements: - GCS Safety Videos Required Annually: - Bloodborne Pathogen Exposure Prevention - FERPA: Confidentiality of Records - GCS – Title IX & Safe Schools - GCS – Code of Ethics & Social Media - GCS – Information Security Mgmt System - GCS – Safety Training - GCS – Mandated Reporter - Greenville Energy Conservation

Position Title: Middle School Head Coach Department: Athletics Reports To: Athletic Director SUMMARY: To plan organize, coordinate and supervise the program in such a way as to produce a team that will be competitive in their classification and conference. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists the athletic director in selection and evaluation of assistant coaches and makes recommendations to the athletic director for assistant coaches. Assumes responsibility for checking all practice areas each day and removes hazardous objects from the practice area. Develops a positive public relations program in the school and the community. Makes recommendations to the athletic director for purchasing football equipment. Provides supervision in the locker rooms before and after practice.. Provides the latest and up-to-date medical procedures for the treatment of athletic injuries. The coach will at all times conduct himself in a manner that will set a good example for students to follow on and off the field. Assumes responsibility with the athletic director for eligibility of participants and insurance coverage of team members. Develops his own schedule with the approval of the athletic director. Assumes responsibility for knowing the latest football rules, South Carolina High School League rules and regulations and School District policies regarding interscholastic sports. Performs other duties as may be assigned by the Supervisor. JOB SPECIFICATIONS SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: All coaches in the school's program and supervises students of particular program. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the district's policies and applicable laws. QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty in a pleasant, professional, efficient manner. Must be reliable, responsible and dependable and fulfill obligations. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: To be decided by Executive Director and/or Building Principal. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Valid South Carolina Teaching Certificate, if applicable. LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before administrators, staff, parents and students. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to interpret and apply common sense understanding in carrying out instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. Ability to analyze information and use logic to address work related issues and problems. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Ability to apply knowledge of current research and theory in specific field. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, staff and the community. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both in oral and written form. Ability to perform duties with awareness of all district requirements and Board of Education policies. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; occasionally walk and stand; travel from building to other sites. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee is required to be able to hear conversations in quiet environments. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works inside. The employee must be able to meet deadlines with severe time constraints. The employee is frequently will work irregular or extended work hours while performing the duties of this job. The employee is directly responsible for safety, well-being and work output of students and coaches. The noise level in the work environment varies from quiet to loud. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT: Seasonal Athletic Supplements Pay Scale EVALUATION: Performance of this job will be evaluated annually according to Board Policy.

Job.JobDescription: General Description Under occasional supervision, aims to carry out the aims and objectives of the ESports program as outlined by the head coach. The ESport Coach reports to the head coach and Principal. Specific Duties and Responsibilities Essential Functions Monitor the grades and discipline records of all students involved in e-sports to make sure they are eligible to participate. Maintain records of parent permission slips, student code of conduct agreements, and other e-sports related paperwork. To instruct individuals on ESport individual and team fundamentals, strategy and training necessary for them to realize a degree of individual and team success. All coaches in Richland County School District One are to be on a coaching agreement. Part-time agreements are to be secured for coaches who work at schools other than where they coach or for coaches who are not otherwise employed by the school district. Volunteer coaches must be approved through the School District volunteer process. ESport team assigned to him/her assumes supervising control over all individuals in program when such control is needed. Essential functions for High School Head Coach ESports Teach and develop the fundamental skills necessary for excellent achievement in his/her area of coaching responsibility. Must be 21 years of age. Plan and schedule a regular program of practice in season. Schedule, with the approval of the Esports Director, inter-scholastic contests. Enforce discipline and sportsmanlike behaviors at all times and with the Esports director establish penalties for breach of such standards by individual students. Ensure that assigned office space is kept clean and orderly. Select or supervise the selection of participants to receive awards and/or letters in accordance with criteria approved by the Esports director. Supervise the care, maintenance and storage of all equipment/supplies throughout the Esports season and forward an inventory to the Esports director or designee annually. Assist in selection and evaluation of assistant coaches and make recommendations to the Principal for assistant coaches. Handle postponement of practice sessions. Develop a positive public relations program in the school and the community. Make recommendations to the Esports director for purchasing all equipment. Provide supervision in all Esports areas. Assume responsibility for turning out all lights and locking all doors before leaving the Esports area (turning on security where applicable). Monitor the grades and discipline records of all students involved in e-sports to make sure they are eligible to participate. Maintain records of parent permission slips, student code of conduct agreements, and other e-sports related paperwork. Duties for ESports Assistant Coach Valid teacher certification/Classified or Approved Non-District Hire Employed as a teacher or Classified Employee in school district Has knowledge and background in Esports Must be 21 years of age Minimum Qualifications and Standards Required Physical Requirements: Tasks involve the ability to exert very moderate physical effort in light work, typically involving some combination of remaining standing for extended periods of time, writing on a chalkboard, stooping, kneeling and crouching, and some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of moderate weight (12 to 20 pounds). Data Conception: Requires the ability to compare and/or judge the readily observable, functional, structural or compositional characteristics (whether similar to or divergent from obvious standards) of data, people or things. Interpersonal Communication: Requires the ability of speaking and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information. Includes receiving assignments and/or directions from supervisors and lecturing / giving instruction and/or assignments to students and assistants. Language Ability: Requires the ability to read a variety of policy and procedure manuals, curriculum materials, texts, computer manuals, etc. Requires the ability to enter data into computer and prepare reports, records, teaching materials, correspondence, etc., with proper format, punctuation, spelling and grammar, using all parts of speech. Must be able to speak with poise, voice control and confidence and to articulate information to others. Intelligence: Requires the ability to apply principles of rational systems to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists; to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in oral, written, diagrammatic or schedule form. Requires the ability to use influence systems in classroom teaching and the supervision of assistants and students. Requires the ability to make independent judgments in the absence of supervisor; to acquire knowledge of topics related to primary occupation. Must have the ability to comprehend and interpret received information and the ability to comprehend and implement basic office machinery functions. Verbal Aptitude: Requires the ability to record and deliver information, to explain procedures, to follow and give oral and written instructions; to counsel and teach students. Must be able to communicate effectively and efficiently with persons of varying ages and educational/cultural backgrounds and using the terminology applicable to the subject area(s) taught. Numerical Aptitude: Requires the ability to add and subtract totals, to multiply and divide, to determine percentages and decimals, to determine time. Must be able to use practical applications of fractions, percentages, ratio and proportion. Form/Spatial Aptitude: Requires the ability to inspect items for proper length, width and shape, and visually read various information. Motor Coordination: Requires the ability to coordinate hands and eyes rapidly and accurately in using automated office equipment and communications machinery.
Job.SalaryRange: Head Coach Rate: $4,202.00, Assistant Coach Rate: $2,843.00

Job.JobDescription:
Richland County School District One, South Carolina Classification Description Classification Title: High School Football Head Coach Salary: $18,430 (4A School)
Specific Duties and Responsibilities • Teach and develop the fundamental skills necessary for excellent achievement in his/her area of coaching responsibility. • Must be 21 years of age. • Plan and schedule a regular program of practice in season. • Schedule, with the approval of the athletic director, inter-scholastic contests. • Enforce discipline and sportsmanlike behaviors at all times and with the athletic director establish penalties for breach of such standards by individual students. • Ensure that assigned office space is kept clean and orderly. • Select or supervise the selection of participants to receive awards and/or letters in accordance with criteria approved by the athletic director. • Supervise the care, maintenance and storage of all equipment/supplies throughout the sport season and forward an inventory to the athletic director or designee annually. • Assist the athletic director in selection and evaluation of assistant coaches and make recommendations to the athletic director for assistant coaches. • Assume responsibility for checking all practice areas each day and remove hazardous objects from the practice area. • Handle postponement of practice sessions. • Develop a positive public relations program in the school and the community. • Make recommendations to the athletic director for purchasing all equipment. • Provide supervision in all athletic areas as well as locker rooms before and after practice and games. • Provide supervision for all athletes in the weight room at all times. • Assume responsibility for turning out all lights and locking all doors before leaving the athletic area (turning on security where applicable). • Assist the athletic director with eligibility of participants and insurance coverage of team members. Note no athlete will be permitted to try out or practice in any athletic program in Richland County School District One until the physical examination form and parent’s permission form are on file in the athletic director’s office. • Be knowledgeable of the latest rules, South Carolina High School League rules and regulations and School District one policies regarding interscholastic sports. • Perform other duties as assigned by the athletic director and principal.

Job.JobDescription: Education and Experience: Job requires a Bachelor's degree or higher with 5 years of coaching experience and must possess a valid teacher certification. Your application must be complete for review; incomplete applications will not be reviewed. The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach role at Taryn Floyd is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Taryn Floyd are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Taryn Floyd, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach at Taryn Floyd, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

Job.JobTitle: ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School (2026-2027 School Year)
Job.JobDescription:
The ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School role at Freehold Township High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Freehold Township High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Freehold Township High School, the ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the ANTICIPATED - Assistant Coach - Football - Freehold Township High School at Freehold Township High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Title: Athletic Coach � JV Softball Work Location: Gallup High School Contract Length: Spring Sport Minimum Salary: $5,000.00 Maximum Salary: $5,000.00
*Internal applicants MUST attach a signed Permission to Coach Form to application*
ATHLETIC COACHING LICENSE, 7-12
Must hold or have the ability to obtain an Athletic Coaching License (https://webnew.ped.state.nm.us/bureaus/licensure/how-to-apply/athletic-coach-7-12/) from the New Mexico Public Education Department as well as completing the Fundamentals of Coaching online exam offered through the New Mexico Activities Association. (www.nmact.org)
QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Has the ability to organize and supervise a total sports program. 2. Has previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. (Major sports) 3. The head coach must have substantial knowledge of the technical aspects of the sport and, at the same time, must continue to examine new theories and procedures pertinent to the field. 4. The head coach must serve as an appropriate role model for student athletes through his/her instructions and actions.
REPORTS TO: The athletic director, who provides overall objectives and final evaluation in conjunction with the high school principals.
WORK ENVIRONMENT: On-site attendance is mandatory for this position.
SUPERVISES: In several instances, the head coach must advise, coordinate and support a staff of high school assistant coaches and middle school coaches in conjunction with the athletic director and respective principal.
JOB GOAL: To instruct athletes in the fundamental skills, strategy and physical training necessary for them to realize a degree of individual and team success. At the same time, the coach must instruct and demonstrate behaviors that lead to socially acceptable character development, self-discipline, self-confidence, and pride of accomplishment in the student athletes. To upgrade his/her knowledge and skills through coaching clinics, observations, consultation, etc.
Work with students interested in sports, provide necessary practice support and advice for a team to be successful against opposing teams in a sports season. Teach and enforce rules and regulations. Involves work on evenings and weekends.
Job.Experience: Has previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. (Major sports)

The Head Girls Lacrosse Coach at Eversole Run Middle School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Head Girls Lacrosse Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Eversole Run Middle School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Head Girls Lacrosse Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Head Girls Lacrosse Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Head Girls Lacrosse Coach at Eversole Run Middle School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

The Volleyball Head Coach Varsity Girls position at Steve Glesenkamp provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Volleyball Head Coach Varsity Girls prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Steve Glesenkamp, the Volleyball Head Coach Varsity Girls works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Volleyball Head Coach Varsity Girls encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Volleyball Head Coach Varsity Girls at Steve Glesenkamp is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Positions: Assistant Football Coaches
Location: Westlake High School
Westlake High School is seeking 2-3 Assistant Football Coaches. Preferred experience includes coaching Running Backs and/or Linebackers, though candidates with other positional experience are encouraged to apply.
These positions require excellent organizational, communication, relational, and teaching/coaching skills, as well as strong football knowledge. We are seeking individuals who bring energy and passion to the entire football program and who are committed to developing young student-athletes both on and off the field. Coaches are expected to serve as positive role models and build strong relationships with student-athletes, families, and the school community. Interested candidates must apply online via Frontline Recruiting & Hiring (formerly AppliTrack) with an updated resume and letter of interest. This posting should remain open until filled. Teaching positions may be available for the upcoming school year.
