Job.JobTitle: Head Boys Golf Coach - Benson HS - 25/26 SY - District Athletics
Job.JobDescription:
Posting Timeline This job is open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as received. Portland Public Schools reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any point during the posting period.
Position Details DISTRICT MISSION: At PPS, our goal is that by the end of elementary, middle and high school every student by name is meeting or exceeding academic standards and is fully prepared to make productive life decisions. DISTRICT PROFILE: To obtain more information about our district, schools, learning environment and programs, please go to https://www.pps.net/Domain/265. Key points of the job description for a Varsity Head Coach: High ethical and professional standards. Direct a successful grade 9-12 program and oversee all facets of an entire community youth program. 3 years of High School coaching experience Be a role model for high school student-athletes. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports by encouraging student-athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program. Lead student-athletes in the support of other Portland Public Schools athletics and activities.
The Head Coach will be responsible for the following: Manage all aspects of the high school program including training, practice schedules and routines. Hire and oversee a staff of assistant coaches Provide regular communication with parents/families Regularly track the academic progress of all student athletes in the program and facilitate necessary supports to ensure their academic eligibility. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports and encourage athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program for athletics.
All new hired coaches will need to complete the following prior to employment: NFHS/ASEP Certification First Aid Card (CPR and AED trained) District Fingerprinting/Criminal check Completion of OSAA Concussion Test Completion of ODE Steroid Test Completion of OSAA Heat Test *Head Up Football *Cheer and Dance/Drill Spirit Safety Training Completion of Portland Public School District paperwork and trainings.
Applicant will be asked to apply online at our website and include the following: A cover letter detailing your experience. A current resume. A minimum of three letters of recommendation/reference.
All PPS job offers are contingent on the satisfactory completion of a background check, including fingerprinting and criminal records.
Salary Range - $6100.00 to $10,000.00
* There is no compensation for summer and out of season workouts.
Portland Public Schools (PPS) is seeking talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences to lead change and inspire PPS students. At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. With the District’s focus on eliminating systemic racism and its adverse impact on student learning, we seek to hire individuals who bring to our district a deep commitment to racial equity and social justice.
The District is committed to equal opportunity and nondiscrimination in all its educational and employment activities. The District prohibits discrimination based on perceived or actual race; national or ethnic origin; color; sex; religion; age; sexual orientation; gender expression or identity; pregnancy; marital status; veteran’s status; familial status; economic status or source of income; mental or physical disability or perceived disability; or military service.
504 Coordinator: Marquita Guzman,mguzman@pps.net, 971-393-8633 ADA Coordinator: Jey Buno, jbuno@pps.net, 503-916-3360 Civil Rights Director: Dr. Bobby Cruz, bcruz@pps.net, 503-839-3660

Position Title: Middle School Head Coach Reports To: Director of Athletics & High School Head Coach Salary: Stipend (set by coaches pay scale) POSITION GOAL: The successful candidate will be responsible for creating a safe and positive atmosphere that welcomes and respects all individuals while promoting and maintaining safe conditions in accordance with PIAA, league, sports medicine and RSD policies/procedures. Furthermore the candidate will be responsible for instilling Red Knight pride, connecting with youth programs, teaching education through athletics, fundraising. QUALIFICATIONS: Must be a minimum age of 18 years old. High School Diploma or equivalent required. Preferable experience working in a supervision role in athletics, recreation, education, or related fields. Exceptional interpersonal skills including the ability to effectively communicate with adults and students in a diverse work environment. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 1. Supervise middle school assistant coaches 2. Supervise student athletes 3. Stay current with current rules, coaching techniques, schemes, and best practices 4. Monitor student-athletes to prevent accidents and injuries. 5. Place student-athletes in positions to succeed not only in their sport, but also in life 6. Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills including communication skills with sports medicine staff, game workers, officials, media, students, parents, spectators, and facility staff. 7. Ensures that all possible safety measures are observed, including taking proper care of equipment and proper surveillance of program participants. 8. Attend all training sessions and any additional staff meetings. 9. Work flexible hours including off season training, early mornings, afternoon/evenings, weekends, and holidays. 10. Verify student-athletes are eligible by PIAA and Reading School District Athletic policies. 11. Demonstrates the ability to plan and manage practices/training sessions. 12. Secure equipment and facilities after each usage 13. Communicate with RSD admin, safe schools, custodial services and/or RPD as needed. 14. Communicate with youth groups and foster participation growth 15. Be a good role model to student-athletes 16. Distribute, collect and track uniforms/equipment 17. Requisition necessary equipment 18. Support all RSD athletics PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Physically perform all skills required of a coach. Hear noises and distress signals in a crowded athletic facility. Able to withstand extreme weather conditions Able to lift at least 20 pounds.

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS at Peirce Middle School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Peirce Middle School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - Head Coach - Football-FOTBLHD PMS at Peirce Middle School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.
Job.Location: Peirce Middle School, West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
The Head HS Boys Soccer Coach position at Chambersburg Senior High provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Head HS Boys Soccer Coach prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Chambersburg Senior High, the Head HS Boys Soccer Coach works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Head HS Boys Soccer Coach encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Head HS Boys Soccer Coach at Chambersburg Senior High is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.
Job.CompanyDescription: Chambersburg Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
The Track and Field Assistant Coach role at Red Land High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Track and Field Assistant Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Red Land High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Track and Field Assistant Coach sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Red Land High School, the Track and Field Assistant Coach is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Track and Field Assistant Coach at Red Land High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Job.JobDescription: Title: Head Coach - Girls Volleyball Reports to: Athletic Director Location: High School Available: Fall 2026 Terms of Employment: Stipend in accordance with EDR Contract as stated in the PEA Collective Bargaining Agreement. Description: Pennridge School District is seeking a dedicated, experienced, and student-centered individual to serve as the Head Coach for our girls volleyball program. This position plays a critical role in developing student-athletes both on and off the field, fostering a culture of excellence, sportsmanship, and teamwork. Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage all aspects of the Girls Volleyball program at the high school level. Plan, organize, and supervise practices and competitions. Ensure the physical and emotional safety of all student-athletes. Promote academic achievement, character development, and personal responsibility. Supervise assistant coaches and collaborate with athletic department staff. Maintain and inventory equipment and uniforms. Represent the program positively within the school and the broader community. Comply with school, district, league, and state athletic association policies and regulations. Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent (Bachelor's degree preferred). Prior coaching experience, preferably at the high school level. Knowledge of rules, strategies, and techniques of the sport. Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills. Ability to build positive relationships with students, parents, and staff. Preferred Qualifications: Valid teaching certificate (if applicable or required by district). CPR/First Aid certification. NFHS coaching certification or willingness to obtain. Experience managing budgets, schedules, and program development. Pre-Employment Paperwork Requirements: Physical and Clearances must be dated within the last 12-months. TB must be dated within the last 90-days. Job.Experience: Prior coaching experience, preferably at the high school level.

Job.JobDescription: Location: South Middle School Available: Immediately Reports to: Athletic Director Terms of Employment: Stipend in accordance with EDR contract as stated in the PEA Collective Bargaining Agreement Description: Pennridge School District is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable individual to serve as an Assistant Coach for our Girls Softball program. This role supports the Head Coach in providing leadership, mentorship, and instruction to student-athletes while promoting a positive, inclusive team culture. Key Responsibilities: Assist the Head Coach with planning and leading practices and competitions. Support the development of student-athletes' skills, teamwork, and sportsmanship. Promote academic achievement and personal growth among athletes. Assist with supervision and safety of all team members during activities. Help manage equipment and maintain team standards of conduct. Model positive behavior and represent the school in a professional manner. Follow all school, district, league, and state athletic association rules. Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. Some coaching or playing experience in the sport (preferably at the high school level). Basic understanding of the game, rules, and strategy. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with the Head Coach and school staff. Preferred Qualifications: CPR/First Aid certification. NFHS coaching certification or willingness to obtain. Experience working with youth or student-athletes. Familiarity with school athletic program policies and procedures. Pre-Employment Paperwork Requirements: Physical and Clearances must be dated within the last 12-months.
Job.Experience: Some coaching or playing experience in the sport (preferably at the high school level).

Job.JobDescription:
The Head Boys Water Polo Coach at Souderton Area High School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Head Boys Water Polo Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Souderton Area High School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Head Boys Water Polo Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Head Boys Water Polo Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Head Boys Water Polo Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Souderton Area High School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.
Job.Location: Souderton Area High School - Souderton, Pennsylvania

Job.JobDescription:
POSITION: Athletic Trainer (Part Time) REPORTS TO: Athletic Director PAY RANGE: MINIMUM $28.15 MID $33.77 MAX $39.40 per hour Vacancies are generally hired between the min-mid; additional compensation may be considered for highly qualified applicants. SCHEDULE: Hours vary REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's Degree (Athletic Trainer)
Please see full job description attached
JOB GOAL To specialize in the prevention, recognition, evaluation and immediate care, rehabilitation and reconditioning of injuries incurred by Centennial School District interscholastic athletes under direction of the team physician as well as area physicians.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 1. Evaluation, treatment, and rehabilitation for athletic injuries in accordance with the Athletic Trainers Standing Protocol, listed below, as directed by the team physician: a. The school physician will supervise the athletic trainer in matters concerning the management and rehabilitation of athletically related injuries and advise on matters regarding the prevention of athletic injuries. b. Centennial's athletic trainers (AT) will be registered with the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania's Department of State Bureau of Professional and Occupational Affairs and certified by the NATA BOC Inc. c. The AT will initiate emergency care for all home athletic events. If there is any question as to the nature or seriousness of any injury, the AT must notify the appropriate parties and refer the athlete for medical evaluation before allowing the athlete to return to play. d. The AT may use heat, cold, water, compression, sound, electricity, electromagnetic waves, massage, traditional mobilization techniques, stretching, and rehabilitative exercise treatments as soon as signs and symptoms indicate their use is proper, and under the direction of a licensed physician. The course of treatment may be changed in consultation with the patient's licensed physician. e. The AT may use bandaging, wrapping, taping, padding, and splinting procedures for the prevention and management of injuries as soon as sign and symptoms indicate their use is proper. f. The AT shall instruct the athlete in the use of crutches and/or canes when the condition necessitates their use. g. The AT may, at his/her discretion, return an athlete to competition after a full physical assessment is completed, unless the athlete is under the proximate care of a licensed physician. When an athlete is under the care of a licensed physician, the AT must have written documentation from that physician in order to return to practice and/or competition. h. Treatment records will be maintained on each athlete receiving any assessment, physical modality, or rehabilitative exercises. Progress notes and physician orders will be included in the record. These records are the property of the school, and must remain of premises at year-end. i. The AT will provide advice regarding basic nutrition, hygiene, and the fitting of protective equipment and padding. j. The AT will not release any medical or injury information to college recruiters, professional scouts, the media, or any other person/entity not specifically permitted to receive such information. 2. Organization and administration of athletic training programs and supplies a. Organize and set up ImPACT testing and wrestling weight certifications and be proficient in the technology required to perform these tasks. c. Issue and maintain team first aid kits, coolers, ice chests, and walkie- talkies. d. Provide guidance, as requested, in the selection of athletic training supplies and equipment. 3. Education and counseling a. Provide guidance to athletes, coaches, and parents in conditioning, flexibility, diet/nutrition, and other applicable areas through effective communication. b. Serve as mentors for student athletic trainers. c. Serve as a resource for information and advice regarding athletic health care. 4. Maintains knowledge of trends in principles of coaching, strategy, and safety.

Job.JobTitle: Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach (Start Date: After The Conclusion Of The 2025-2026 Winter Season)
Job.JobDescription:
The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach role at Avon Grove High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Avon Grove High School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Avon Grove High School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach at Avon Grove High School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

Job.JobTitle: Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach role at North Hills School District emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At North Hills School District, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent North Hills School District at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Flag Football - Girls Varsity Assistant Coach must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at North Hills School District.

Job.JobTitle: High School Co-Ed Track and Field Assistant Coach
Job.JobDescription:
Muhlenberg High School has a vacancy for a Co-Ed Track and Field Assistant Coach. Beginning Spring 2026 season. Successful candidates should believe in the importance of the impact of extra-curricular activities in a child's K-12 experience and overall social, emotional and academic development.
Preferred: * Prior coaching experience in track and field, with specialization in vaulting and some jumping events. * Bilingual candidates
Required: * High School Diploma * Knowledge of sport/ Experience in the sport * Ability to work in a team setting * Ability to give clear direction * Ability to supervise and direct others, with emphasis on safety with vaulting and jumping events * Must be interested in supporting and working with all student-athletes * Knowledge of PIAA rules and policies governing the sport * Ability to work within the Blueprint/Action Plan of the Muhlenberg School District * Clearly communicate to student athletes, parents, school officials and sport officials
Interested applicants must have current clearances, Acts 34, 114, 151 and 168.
The successful candidate will be required to participate in all training as required by PIAA. To apply, please visit https://www.applitrack.com/muhlsdk12/onlineapp/ and select Athletics/Activities. All applicants must fully complete the online application including the submission of all current clearances (must be within one year of hire) to be considered.

Successful candidates should believe in the importance of the impact of extra-curricular activities in a child's K-12 experience and overall social, emotional and academic development.
Preferred: * Prior coaching experience in scholastic softball * Bilingual candidates
Required: * High School Diploma * Knowledge of sport/ Experience in the sport * Ability to work in a team setting * Ability to give clear direction * Ability to supervise and direct others * Must be interested in supporting and working with all student-athletes * Knowledge of PIAA rules and policies governing the sport * Ability to work within the Blueprint/Action Plan of the Muhlenberg School District * Clearly communicate to student athletes, parents, school officials and sport officials * Work collaboratively/cooperatively with the High School Head Coach to ensure their philosophy is being carried out throughout the program
Interested applicants must have current clearances, Acts 34, 114, 151 and 168 and three professional references.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 2.3.26 Cheltenham School District announces the following ANTICIPATED extra duty-extra pay position(s) is available for the 2026-2027 school-year, at Cheltenham High School:
Field Hockey - Head Coach
Reports to: Athletic Director Job Description: ... Qualifications Must have extensive knowledge of the sport and the ability to effectively teach and communicate fundamental skills. Must have at least 2 - 4 years of coaching experience working with children and/or adolescents; coaching at the high school level preferred. A strong understanding of the sports theory and practice is required; experience as a player or coach at the high school or collegiate level is preferred. Must demonstrate the personal qualities necessary to foster sportsmanship and support student-athlete success in a positive and encouraging environment.
